New Records: Shohei Ohtani became the first player in MLB history to post at least 50 home runs and 50 stolen bases in a single season
Shohei Ohtani became the only player in Dodgers history to record 10 RBIs in a single game
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit three home runs, including two in the same game against the Miami Marlins
Shohei Ohtani stole 50 bases in a single season, a feat no other player has achieved in MLB history
Pre-Game Insights: Shohei Ohtani entered the contest with 48 home runs and 49 stolen bases, closing in on baseball immortality
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers clinched a postseason bid following their 20-4 win, improving to a 91-62 record on the season
Miscellaneous Highlights: Shohei Ohtani finished going 6-for-6 at the plate on the evening
Shohei Ohtani set multiple records through the night, including most RBIs in a game in Dodgers history
